# WebGPU and TypeGPU Guide

## Documentation Sets

- [Abridged documentation](http://localhost:4321/llms-small.txt): a compact version of the documentation for WebGPU and TypeGPU Guide, with non-essential content removed
- [Complete documentation](http://localhost:4321/llms-full.txt): the full documentation for WebGPU and TypeGPU Guide
- [WebGPU Core Concepts](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/webgpu-core-concepts.txt): Understanding GPUAdapter, GPUDevice, GPUQueue, and the WebGPU architecture
- [Canvas Configuration and Context](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/canvas-configuration-and-context.txt): Setting up the rendering surface with canvas context and presentation
- [Command Encoders and Submission](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/command-encoders-and-submission.txt): Building and submitting command buffers to the GPU queue
- [WGSL Shading Language](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/wgsl-shading-language.txt): The WebGPU Shading Language syntax, data types, and functions
- [WGSL Address Spaces](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/wgsl-address-spaces.txt): Understanding function, private, workgroup, uniform, and storage address spaces
- [TypeGPU Getting Started](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/typegpu-getting-started.txt): Setting up TypeGPU with bundlers and writing your first type-safe GPU program
- [Error Handling and Validation](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/error-handling-and-validation.txt): WebGPU's error model, device lost handling, and validation errors
- [Data Schemas in TypeGPU](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/data-schemas-in-typegpu.txt): Defining structs, vectors, matrices, and arrays with type inference
- [Buffers and Memory Management](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/buffers-and-memory-management.txt): Creating, reading, writing, and managing GPU buffers
- [Render Pipelines](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/render-pipelines.txt): Vertex shaders, fragment shaders, and the graphics rendering pipeline
- [Compute Pipelines](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/compute-pipelines.txt): General-purpose GPU computing with compute shaders and workgroups
- [TGSL Functions](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/tgsl-functions.txt): Writing shader functions in TypeScript with TypeGPU's TGSL
- [Workgroup Variables and Shared Memory](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/workgroup-variables-and-shared-memory.txt): Using workgroup-scoped variables for inter-thread communication
- [Slots and Derived Values](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/slots-and-derived-values.txt): Dynamic resource binding with slots and computed values with derived
- [Bind Groups and Layouts](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/bind-groups-and-layouts.txt): Connecting resources to shaders with type-safe bindings
- [Textures and Samplers](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/textures-and-samplers.txt): Working with images, texture mapping, and sampling operations
- [WGSL Builtin Functions](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/wgsl-builtin-functions.txt): Reference for math, vector, texture, and synchronization functions in WGSL
- [TypeGPU Tooling](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/typegpu-tooling.txt): Build tools and CLI utilities for TypeGPU development
- [TypeGPU Utilities](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/typegpu-utilities.txt): Noise generation, color spaces, and helper packages for TypeGPU
- [Loading Images and Textures](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/loading-images-and-textures.txt): Loading images, video frames, and compressed textures into WebGPU
- [Instancing and Indirect Drawing](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/instancing-and-indirect-drawing.txt): Efficient rendering of many objects with instancing and GPU-driven draws
- [Render Bundles](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/render-bundles.txt): Pre-recorded command sequences for reducing CPU overhead
- [Storage Textures](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/storage-textures.txt): Direct texture writes from compute and fragment shaders
- [Multisampling (MSAA)](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/multisampling-msaa.txt): Anti-aliasing with multisample render targets
- [React Integration](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/react-integration.txt): WebGPU patterns for React web and React Native applications
- [Camera and View Matrices](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/camera-and-view-matrices.txt): Camera math, projection matrices, and wgpu-matrix usage
- [Advanced TypeGPU Patterns](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/advanced-typegpu-patterns.txt): Externals, resolve API, WebGPU interoperability, and React Native support
- [Performance Optimization](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/performance-optimization.txt): Best practices for GPU memory, pipeline efficiency, and profiling
- [Atomic Operations](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/atomic-operations.txt): Thread-safe operations in compute shaders for concurrent data access
- [Coordinate Systems and Clip Space](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/coordinate-systems-and-clip-space.txt): Understanding WebGPU's 0-to-1 depth range and coordinate transformations
- [Timestamp Queries and Profiling](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/timestamp-queries-and-profiling.txt): Measuring GPU execution time with query sets and performance callbacks
- [WebGPU vs WebGL Migration](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/webgpu-vs-webgl-migration.txt): Differences, advantages, and migration considerations including coordinate system changes
- [Debugging GPU Code](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/debugging-gpu-code.txt): GPU console.log, validation layers, and debugging techniques
- [Browser Compatibility](http://localhost:4321/_llms-txt/browser-compatibility.txt): Current support status, feature detection, and fallback strategies

## Notes

- The complete documentation includes all content from the official documentation
- The content is automatically generated from the same source as the official documentation
